abstract: The share price that Facebook has used for its employee stock options rose more than 30-fold between January 2006 and August 2007. It’s likely to experience another steep jump in value after Microsoft’s investment is factored in.

lead_paragraph: The phrase “pre-IPO shares” is a powerful recruiting magnet in Silicon Valley, where dreams of striking it rich on the back of stock options motivate startup employees to work around the clock. If the shares come from a hot company, say Facebook, the proposition can prove as irresistible as a lottery ticket with short odds.
